text: The Union Buildings () form the official seat of the South African Government. They also have the offices of the President of South Africa. The buildings are located on the Meintjieskop in Pretoria, which is the highest point of the city. In December 2013, the buildings were declared a national heritage site. Designed by Herbert Baker, the buildings were made from sandstone. == References == Category:Monuments and memorials in South Africa Category:Buildings and structures completed in the 20th century Category:Buildings and structures in Pretoria
title: Union Buildings
